reviewText: Great band bringing back that old classic tejano horn-style feeling. Don't hear it often now-a-days. Great DVD for the music collector.

ESTO NO FUE CULPA DEL ARTISTA SEGUN SABEMOS LA DISQUERA SE ENCARGO DE TODO NO TENIENDO LA EXPERIENCIA PARA ELLO
ESTE ARTISTA TIENE UNA CARRERA DE CALIDAD INCUESTIONABLE Y HA DEMOSTRADO SU EXCELENCIA , NOS ENTERAMOS QUE ESTA PREPARANDO UN DVD CON SU TOTAL PRODUCCION , SI SE FIJAN EL DISCO EL CD DEL CONCIERTO  SUENA PERFECTO.
I could not believe the horrible sound coming out of my 7.1 system. Visual is good. How cheap can his rep be (Juan Y Nelson).

I'm disappointed with this DVD.  Mr. Peralta is an outstanding showman, forged in the merengue styles of the great Juan Luis Guerra.  I have heard his CDs and they have been amazing.  I bought this DVD expecting a top-notch sound and video production and was surprised by the lacking sound.  The camera work is fine and does not distract form the show.  But, the sound was coming out Mono on my system, and was not coming out of my surround sound speakers.  I own Bobby Valentin's 35th Anniversary Salsa concert in the Oso Blanco Prison (Puerto Rico) and the Celia Cruz Azucar tribute, so I know what a good DVD-Latin music production should sound like.  As an enthuiast and collector of over 15 different DVD salsa collections, I am severely disappointed with the quality of this DVD.  This needed more studio work before coming out.  What really angers me is that, with the money Mr. Peralta makes and the huge budget he had to have for this DVD, why didn't he make a top-notch production?  There really is no excuse for the poor sound quality (the sound is good, but only in Mono.  No surround sound or stereo of any kind!)
If Mr. Peralta wants to approximate his mentor's quality level (Juan Luis Guerra), then he needs to demand better of his studio engineers and production people.  If you really want a Peralta DVD, get it.  But, I'd wait around until he decides to do a good DVD, not just a "average" one.

Es lastimoso que una compania con Juan & Nelson no puedan realizar DVD musical que valga la pena.
No puede ser por dinero porque muchos sabes que cuesta realizar un DVD. lES RECOMIENDO A J&N que empiensen grabar sus DVD en formato esterio. He ahi la causa del mal sonido.
Digamos no a los productos malos de J&N

Amigos, me apena mucho decirles que no me siento nada feliz con este DVD. Pense que mis compatriotas harian un esfuerzo para proporcionar una buena calidad del sonido (todo lo contrario). Los metales son demasiado fuertes y los bajos parecen estar ausentes. Compre este DVD porque queria tener en mi coleccion un buen exponente del merengue, como lo es Eddy Herrera, pero no esperaba tan mala demostracin de sonido. En buen Dominicano "Suena como un laterio". Por lo menos tiene muy buena calidad de imagen, pero eso no es suficiente.
Espero que mis comentarios ayuden a mejorar tanto a Eddy como a otros buenos cantantes Dominicanos en producciones posterios a esta.
